snippet: A federal appeals court said there was “no legitimate state interest” in treating young immigrants differently from other noncitizens with work permits.
abstract: Federal appeals court blocks Arizona's policy of denying driver's licenses to young immigrants who have received work permits and avoided deportation under Obama administration's Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court said there was “no legitimate state interest” in treating young immigrants differently from other noncitizens with work permits.

headline.main: Court Blocks Arizona Policy of Denying Driver’s Licenses to Some Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Court Blocks Arizona Policy of Denying Driver’s Licenses to Some Immigrants

keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
keywords.name: subject
